title: Planned Parenthood Plans $45 Million Campaign To Keep Their Baby-Killing Agenda Alive
text:
Well, with the 2020 election cycle about to hit full swing, along with impeachment theater engulfing the Hill, Planned Parenthood decided to announce that they’re investing some $45 million to boot Trump and retake the Senate. While some states, like Georgia and Alabama, have passed stricter abortion laws, New York passed one that permitted the procedure pretty much up until the moment of birth. That’s infanticide, but Democrats support it because supporting baby-killing is a hallmark characteristic of this party. Yes, it is an unpopular position. The country is roughly split 50-50 pro-life, pro-abortion. And while the vast majority does support the Roe v. Wade ruling, healthy majorities support restrictions on abortion especially after 20 weeks into a pregnancy. If there is one thing to get college-educated women in a frenzy, it’s the pro-abortion propaganda peddled by the Left that Republicans seek to turn this nation into an episode of The Handmaiden’s Tale. If you don’t know what that is, fear not; no one watches it anyway (via The Hill):

Planned Parenthood's super PAC announced a $45 million electoral campaign on Wednesday to defeat President Trump and Republicans in key Senate races. The investment will fund a "large-scale" grassroots organization and canvass, digital, television, radio and mail programs. "The stakes are higher than ever, and we're coming out more powerfully than ever with the largest investment we've ever made," said Kelley Robinson, executive director of Planned Parenthood Votes, in an interview with The Hill. The campaign will focus on Arizona, Colorado, Florida, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. Those states are must-wins for Trump. But Republican senators are also fighting to keep their seats in Arizona, Colorado and North Carolina in races that will determine which party controls the Senate after 2020. The campaign, which could exceed $45 million, will tell voters there is a "coordinated attack" among Republicans in state legislatures, Congress and the White House to overturn Roe v. Wade, the landmark Supreme Court ruling that established the right to an abortion.

Planned Parenthood just announced a $45 million anti-GOP ad campaign in battleground states for 2020, but remember, PP is a women’s health-care organization, not a political-action group. — Alexandra DeSanctis (@xan_desanctis) October 9, 2019

I mean, this is just one of the many enemies we’ll be facing next year. We all know the Left is coming after Trump and the rest of us—hard. This isn’t time to be compromising, empathetic, or compassionate. We need to kill these people—politically speaking. Chop them down, put them through a meat grinder, douse the remains in gasoline, and set it on fire. We cannot be nice to the Left. We cannot be friends with the Left. We cannot show mercy to the Left. This will be a street fight. It’ll be a year-long campaign, maybe longer, in the gutter. And I can’t wait!

Also, funny how we all just forgot that the nation's largest abortion provider booted their recent president because she wasn't woke enough or something.
